document_info.title: STB and Limtek Extraction Methods - Technical Reference
document_info.source: DMT-Nexus Wiki / The Nexian DMT Handbook
document_info.purpose: Comprehensive guide to Straight-To-Base and Limtek extraction techniques
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical extraction chemistry research.

straight_to_base.definition: Simplest extraction technique using strong base to convert DMT salt to freebase
straight_to_base.mechanism: Strong base breaks down source material and converts product from natural salt form to freebase, which is more soluble in NPS than basic aqueous solution

pros: Requires little experience or technical know-how
Best for quick, non-labor-intensive crude bulk extractions
Enables more thorough exhaustion of product from material
Ideal for shredded material requiring no defatting
cons: Requires time for soaking and separation
Tends to yield greater array of botanical impurities

equipment: Chemically resistant vessel for reaction and agitation

material_considerations.lye_warning: Extremely toxic and hazardous, though most find easy to handle safely
material_considerations.solvent_volume: STB methods generally demand hefty volume of solvents

naphtha_heptane.dmt_solubility: Poor - requires heating for considerable pulls

toluene_xylene.range: Wider range of alkaloids and other substances
toluene_xylene.methods: Do not facilitate freeze-precipitation but DO facilitate FASA

dcm.unique: Unlike other NPS, it SINKS in water

diethyl_ether_heptane.technique: Ether distilled off rapidly, leaving alkaloid-saturated heptane ready for freeze precipitation
diethyl_ether_heptane.warning: Diethyl ether is EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE - exercise extreme caution

limonene.methods: Does not facilitate FASA or freeze-precipitation BUT does facilitate FASW and FASIPA

solvent_options.evaporation_note: Most solvents do not facilitate expedient or clean evaporation; heptane and naphtha tend to be most effective

straight_to_base.material_preparation: Source material must be at least shredded, preferably powdered. Pre-treating with acid soak (with or without heat) prior to basic solution found beneficial
procedure: 1. Prepare basic solution pH 12-14 by adding base to appropriate amount of water
2. Immerse pulverized source material in basic solution
3. Allow time for material breakdown and freebase conversion
4. Stir or shake in target solvent to ensure adequate dissolution
5. Allow solvent to separate into two distinct layers
6. Separate using appropriate methods (siphoning, pipetting, separatory funnel)
7. Collect solvent and proceed with crystallization

limtek_extraction.name_origin: Named for d-Limonene and pickling Lime
limtek_extraction.distinguishing_feature: Unique way lime must be used (similar to drytek) plus hygrophobic properties of limonene

lime_chemistry.behavior: Qualifies as strong base but does NOT behave as such in solution
lime_chemistry.key_technique: Must be mixed into PASTE with source material and MINIMAL water to behave as strong base

limonene_advantage.benefit: Source material can remain moist throughout extraction
limonene_advantage.comparison: Drytek requires moisture removal which terminates reaction - limtek does not

considerations.nontoxic: Food-grade throughout, using no toxic or hazardous materials
considerations.minimal_volume: Uses absolute minimum material and volume possible
considerations.no_aqueous_phase: No proper aqueous phase means no separatory methods needed prior to salting
considerations.disposal: Facilitates solid disposal instead of dumping large toxic solution volumes
considerations.legal_benefit: Bears least resemblance to production of other substances, reducing legal risks

acid_for_salting.requirement: Aqueous food-grade acid to remain nontoxic
acid_for_salting.FASW: Fumaric Acid Saturated Water - evaporates to crystalline DMT fumarate
acid_for_salting.vinegar: Achieves DMT acetate but will NOT crystallize

material_considerations.solvent_substitution: Limonene can be replaced with other NPS but process ceases to be nontoxic

procedure.action: Mix powdered material with lime between 1:2 and 1:1 ratio, mix thoroughly
procedure.note: No reaction occurs yet - thorough mixing ensures even reaction later

procedure.action: Thoroughly moisten mixture while stirring - no dry spots, doughy/pasty consistency
chemistry: Water facilitates reaction and basic environment
Acid component of natural salt-form is neutralized

procedure.action: Ensure thoroughly homogeneous mixture, allot time and stirring for complete reaction
procedure.importance: MOST IMPORTANT PART for successful yield
procedure.reason: Lack of proper aqueous phase requires stronger manual facilitation

procedure.action: Wash mixture with NPS by stirring and decanting to collect NPS
procedure.tip: More contact between material and solvent = more successful extraction
